title: Calories in Beef for Stew
meta_description: Learn calories in beef for stew per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition details for stewing beef.
assumptions: Lean chuck beef cubes, braised/cooked, trimmed of visible fat, no added salt, oil, or vegetables.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking method, and added ingredients. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked beef for stew provides ~190 kcal and ~30g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp oil per 100g during cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of beef for stew?
faqs.a: About 190 kcal for cooked lean beef for stew.

faqs.q: What's the protein in beef for stew?
Does beef for stew have carbs?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain cooked beef for stew.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in beef for stew?
faqs.a: Cooking reduces water content, increasing calories per gram compared to raw (135 kcal raw vs. 190 kcal cooked).

faqs.q: What cut is best for low-calorie beef stew?
faqs.a: Lean chuck or round cuts; trim fat to keep under 200 kcal per 100g cooked.
